timeline.message:

changed_code.chunk:
@@ -121,8 +121,8 @@ public class JsonArray implements Iterable<Object>, ClusterSerializable, Shareab
    * Get the Integer at position {@code pos} in the array,
    *
    * @param pos the position in the array
-   * @return the Integer, or null if a null value present
-   * @throws java.lang.ClassCastException if the value cannot be converted to Integer
+   * @return the Number, or null if a null value present
+   * @throws java.lang.ClassCastException if the value cannot be converted to Number
    */
   public Number getNumber(int pos) {
     return (Number) list.get(pos);

timeline.body:
```suggestion
   * @throws java.lang.ClassCastException if the value is not a Number
```
There is no conversion, only casting.

There is no conversion, only casting.
timeline.author: julianladisch

commits_in_main.message: Json ClusterSerializable: skip intermediate String conversion

JSON improvements: - improve JsonObject#getMap and JsonArray#getList javadoc to better define the expectations of the returned data structure - remove the best effort generic CharSequence support in JacksonCodec and tread arbitrary non string CharSequence as a POJO like databind would do - add a test for JSON encoding for all supported types such as Instant, byte[] or Buffer
JavaDoc that JsonObject#copy and JsonArray#copy make a deep copy.

JsonObject/JsonArray provide a copy method that can fail on unknown elements when they cannot be copied by throwing an IllegalStateException. We can provide an overloaded version that uses a Function<Object, ?> to copy unknown elements and avoid failing.
Explicitly document and test the 'stream()' contract
Add a convenient way to create JsonObject and JsonArray
More efficiently JsonObject.of and other suggestions from #4401
Args length & null check for JsonObject.of and JsonArray.of
Noisy API to create JsonObject and JsonArray follow JDK pattern
JsonXxx.of add items with API for validation
JsonArray.of does not need a noisy API
